title: Rated "R" Font
content: It's very [Melior](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/melior/)-like, but it's not Melior. [Renault](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/renault/) is also similar. I suspect they were custom designed for the ratings board when they were introduced in the late 1960s. [This poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143613/http:/www.filmratings.com/images/poster5.jpg), which shows all of them together, seems to support this. The ratings that were added later--NC-17 and the 13 in PG-13--don't match the style. In the early years of the system, there was also X, and, for a short time, M and GP.
author: Mark Simonson

comments.content:
Wow, they didn't even bother to use the same font for the "13" and the "NC-17"ï¿½the "13" looks Korinna-ish, and the NC-17 Palatino-ish, but they don't seem to match digital versions exactly.   
   
As for the other fonts: RESTRICTED is [Helvetica Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/black/testdrive.html?s=RESTRICTED&p=48), but I don't know about the "UNDER 17...". Superficially it looks like Alternate Gothic or Trade Gothic Bold, but the Q and R clearly don't match those. The only face I know that combines that kind of Q with that kind of R is Folio, but I can't seem to find a weight of Folio that matches that sample.
Univers Condensed has the wrong Q but otherwise gives you a pretty good match.
